title: Marcos Alonso shows off his free-kick prowess by scoring with Willy Cabellero used as a target
text:
Chelsea's Marcos Alonso showcased his outrageous dead-ball ability in training as he scored into the top corner with team mate Willy Caballero used as a target.

Alonso, 28, managed to convince the goalkeeper to climb onto the goal frame and leave a space in the top right corner for him to place the ball from outside the penalty area and to Cabellero's relief, Alonso managed to pull it off.

The Chelsea wing-back posted the video to his Instagram account with the caption 'When you need your bro to train free-kicks but he trusts you'.

Alonso lines up a free-kick in training and uses Willy Cabellero as a target in the top corner

The strike curls into the top right corner narrowly avoiding the hanging goalkeeper

The two Chelsea stars celebrate with a hug after Alonso's amazing free-kick

Marcos Alonso posted the video to social media and fans absolutely love it

Alonso is not the only free-kick taker at Chelsea, with others also gifted from a dead ball

Alonso is one of a few free-kick taker options in Frank Lampard's side with Willian, Mason Mount and Jorginho also gifted from dead-ball scenarios.

The defender is one of Chelsea's strongest free-kick takers and has scored some memorable set-piece goals in his time at the club.

In August 2017, Alonso scored potentially his best free-kick for Chelsea against London rivals Tottenham at Wembley Stadium. His left-footed strike went just over the wall and nestled the top corner past the stretching Hugo Lloris. The goal was the first of a brace for the Spaniard in that match.

The 28-year-old scored another impressive free-kick against Southampton a few months after his Wembley heroics - fooling Fraser Forster in the Saints goal with a curling bottom corner effort.

Alonso scored a memorable free-kick against London rivals Tottenham back in 2017

He also scored a free-kick against Southampton in the league, not long after the Spurs goal

Alonso has been impressive in recent weeks for Chelsea and scored the winning goal against Newcastle last weekend.

The Spaniard is fighting for a spot in the starting eleven along with fellow left-back, Emerson. Alonso has featured in six Premier League matches so far this season and has scored once and assisted twice.

He is available for selection ahead of Chelsea's Champions League match against Ajax on Wednesday in Group H.
